headline: Jones Soda Co. Engages Hayden, IR Expanding Investor Relations Efforts to Support its Investor Outreach and Communications
summary: Jones Soda Co. (CSE: JSDA) (OTCQB: JSDA) ("Jones Soda" or the "Company"), today announced that it has engaged the services of Hayden IR, a highly recognized, national investor relations firm, to provide investor communications, outreach efforts, and other investor relations services to the Company (the "Services").

headline: Costco quietly reshapes the way members shop
summary: For decades, Costco offered members a simple proposition. Pay an annual membership fee and get access to the chain's warehouses, where it sells a narrow selection of high-volume items at very good prices. Until 1998, Costco did not even sell items directly through its website. You had to visit its ...

headline: FedEx is latest company to sue Trump admin. for tariff refunds
summary: FedEx (FDX) has filed a lawsuit seeking refunds on President Trump's tariff policies, while Costco (COST) and Revlon have also staked claims following a recent Supreme Court decision that struck down the administration's sweeping tariffs. The ruling did not address whether companies would be reimbursed. Sevens Report Research founder Tom Essaye joins the live show with Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre and Yahoo Finance Senior Markets Reporter Ines Ferré to break down what the tariff uncertainty means for companies, consumers, and markets. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: FedEx joins other US companies in seeking a refund after Trump tariffs are ruled illegal
summary: FedEx is suing the U.S. government, requesting a full refund on what it paid for tariffs set by President Donald Trump last year after the Supreme Court ruled that the tariffs are illegal.  FedEx said in a filing with the U.S. Court of International Trade that they have “suffered injury” from having to pay the tariffs and that the relief they're seeking from the court would redress those injuries.  Other companies have already launched efforts to recoup costs from the illegal tariffs, including large U.S. corporations like Costco and Revlon.

headline: Costco Expands Levels Whey Protein As Valuation And Membership Story Evolves
summary: Costco Wholesale expanded distribution of Levels Whey Protein across its warehouses in the Pacific Northwest and several additional states. The rollout brings a wider range of high quality, clean label protein products into Costco’s health and wellness assortment. The move supports Costco’s efforts to offer rigorously certified products that cater to growing demand for ingredient transparency and product safety. For investors watching Costco Wholesale, NasdaqGS:COST, this product expansion...
